quote_first: There was only one time I was not on the receiving end. It was Tuesday-my half day-and at
quote_last: a call came in. An eversion of the uterus in a cow. This is the tough job in the country practice and I felt the usual chill.
title: All Creatures Great and Small
author: James Herriot

quote_first: Five minutes later another truck pulls up behind the first. On the side of this one is a grinning cartoon boy woofing down a double cheeseburger. At
quote_last: , while people are lined up for burgers and fries and tacos and enchiladas, a hotdog wagon appears.
title: Billy Summers
author: Stephen King

quote_first: I woke up in a panic, not screaming, just a groan from deep in my throat. I’d dozed off in the hard plastic chair by the window. The clock above the door showed
quote_last: and the ICU was dead silent. Adrenaline supply not yet depleted, I staggered to my feet.
title: Echo
author: Thomas Olde Heuvelt

quote_first: And so it was that around
quote_last: , I found myself riding down to the Village on the Fifth Avenue bus with the street address of Hobart and Blackwell in my pocket, written on a page from one of the monogrammed notepads Mrs Barbour kept by the telephone.
title: The Goldfinch
author: Donna Tartt

quote_first: “The extraordinary thing is,” he told Livia at
quote_last: , “you seem to be the only applicant. Or at least, the only one who’s showed up.”
title: The Wedding Officer
author: by Anthony Capella

quote_last: . The door to this room is shut, and will remain shut, barring emergencies, until 12.00. I am authorised to inform you that we are now under battle orders.
title: Singularity Sky
author: Charles Stross

quote_last: to a minute as you said.
title: Far from the Madding Crowd

title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie
